org.svvrl.goal.gui

Class Tab

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.svvrl.goal.gui.Tab
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, EditableListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ControllableTab, EditorTab, InputSimulatorTab, RunDagTab, RunTreeTab, SplitTreeTab

    public abstract class Tab
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements EditableListener
    A Tab is a tab in a GOAL window. It is assumed that a tab contains a main editor for editing an editable object.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setEditable

        public void setEditable(Editable obj)
        Sets the editable object in this tab. A suitable editor in the repository EditorRepository will be instantiated.
        Parameters:
        obj - an editable object to be edited in this tab

      • save

        public void save(java.io.File file,
                 Codec codec)
        Saves the editable object in this tab to a specified file by a specified codec. The dirty bit of the object will be reset. The saved file will appear in the recent files.
        Parameters:
        file - a file where the encoded editable object is to be written
        codec - a coded used to encode the editable object

      • save

        public boolean save()
        Saves the editable object in this tab to the file associated with the object using the previously used codec.
        Returns:
        true if saved successfully
        See Also:
        save(File, Codec)

      • saveAs

        public boolean saveAs()
        Opens a dialog for choosing the file and codec and saves the editable object in this tab. The available codecs will be codecs that can do both encoding and decoding. The first selected codec will be the previously used codec in this tab. If there is no codec used in this tab, the system default codec will be used.
        Returns:
        true if saved successfully
        See Also:
        save(File, Codec)

      • saveAs

        public boolean saveAs(Codec suggested)
        Opens a dialog for choosing the file and codec and saves the editable object in this tab. The available codecs will be codecs that can do both encoding and decoding. The first selected codec will be the suggested codec.
        Parameters:
        suggested - a suggested codec
        Returns:
        true if saved successfully
        See Also:
        save(File, Codec)

      • export

        public void export()
        Opens a dialog for choosing the file and codec and saves the editable object in this tab. All the codecs that can encode the object will be available in exporting.
        See Also:
        export(File, Codec)

      • export

        public void export(java.io.File file,
                   Codec codec)
        Exports the editable object in this tab to a specified file by a specified codec. The dirty bit of the object will not be reset. The saved file will not appear in the recent files.
        Parameters:
        file - a file where the encoded editable object is to be written
        codec - a coded used to encode the editable object

      • prepareExit

        public boolean prepareExit()
        Prepares exit and ask the user to save the editable object in this tab before exit if the object has been modified.
        Returns:
        true if this tab is ready for exit

        Parameters:
        e - the event issued by the interested editable object
